message:
We run for our lives, dashing down the brilliantly lit street and slipping into a narrow alley.

Someone is following us窶付he police or the yakuza, I don't know.
Eventually, after we've made several random turns, the footsteps fade.
Just as I'm about to stop and check―
Someone jumps out in front of us.
I freeze. I can't believe who it is.

name: 悪島
message: "I HAVE A WARRANT FOR YOUR ARREST, SCUMBAAAAAAAGS!"

name: 悪島
message: "I was transferred to Platinum Jail to take care of you DAMN TERRORIIIIIIIIIIISTS!"
Now here's someone who really doesn't know when to quit. I get ready to make a break for it... but then, I realize something's wrong.
He's always been a psycho, but now, while his eyes are wide open to match his smile, they seem vacant and hollow.
Akushima spreads his arms with a dramatic flourish, then aims something at us.
What is that? It looks like a giant, modified megaphone...
Suddenly, Noiz knocks me out of the way.
Before I can finish, Akushima's megaphone fires what looks like a ball of electricity. It flies past with incredible speed, just grazing the top of my head.
I jump up and turn around. The wall behind us―is gone.
Noiz, who ducked with me to avoid the blast, gives Akushima a hard look.

name: ノイズ
message: "He's gonna be a pain in the ass if we don't get rid of him."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Can we even do that? He's got that weird weapon."
Noiz and I scatter to avoid the second bolt.
One of Akushima's shots hits a wall right next to me, blasting it to pieces.
Noiz dodges the bolt by a hair and drives his brass knuckles into Akushima's chest.
But he ignores me and keeps wailing on Akushima.
I'm a little scared by his viciousness. Sure, Akushima's attacks were frightening, but so is this!
At this rate, Noiz is gonna kill him!
Akushima's head dangles from his shoulders, his face a battered mess.
Suddenly, Akushima starts to laugh, his bloody mouth opening wide.
He grabs Noiz's neck with one hand, and with his other, jabs the megaphone into Noiz's stomach.
The world goes silent. The only sounds I hear are the pounding of my heart and the ringing in my ears.
